intro: Buchanania barberi, commonly known as the African blackwood, is a tropical tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic foliage. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptic in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Buchanania barberi is valued for its hard, durable wood used in traditional crafts and as a source of medicinal compounds.
